data.title: Antonia Adnet • Maestra
data.text:
Biography

The Brazilian music director/producer, arranger, guitarist and singer worked on several awarded recording, live concert and musical projects with editing, revision and formatting scores/parts, planning schedules, assisting rehearsals and producing recordings, mixing and mastering. Antonia released 3 solo albums: Tem + Boogie Woogie no Samba (2015), Pra dizer sim (2012) and Discreta (2010), singing and playing songs and arrangements of her own. She worked as a guitarist (nylon acoustic guitar) and vocalist in bands and concerts with different instrumentations.

Awards and nominations:

Shell Theater Award (Brazilian) 2019 – Winner – best music category – ‘Musical Elza’ – music director

Latin Grammy 2016 – nominee – ‘Jobim Jazz ao vivo’ (Mario Adnet) – assistant music director

Latin Grammy 2015 – nominee – ‘Dorival Caymmi Centenário’ (Dori Caymmi and Mario Adnet) – assistant music director

Latin Grammy 2013 – nominee – ‘Um olhar sobre Villa-Lobos’ (Mario Adnet) – assistant music director
